snippet: Deep divisions in the Obama administration over rising violence in Syria spilled into public view for the first time in a blunt exchange between Senator John McCain of Arizona and the leaders of the Pentagon.
abstract: Deep divisions in the Obama administration over rising violence in Syria spill into public view for the first time in blunt exchange between Senator John McCain of Arizona and the leaders of the Pentagon; Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta, testifying before Senate Armed Services Committee, acknowledges he and chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Gen Martin E Dempsey, supported plan in 2012 to arm carefully vetted Syrian rebels, but plan was vetoed by White House.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: Deep divisions in the Obama administration over rising violence in Syria spilled into public view for the first time in a blunt exchange between Senator John McCain of Arizona and the leaders of the Pentagon.

headline.seo: White House Tensions Over Syria Exposed in Hearing
headline.main: Senate Hearing Draws Out a Rift in U.S. Policy on Syria
headline.print_headline: Deeper Divide On Syria Policy Comes to Light

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
